thread.title: Rupee strengthens 8 paise against dollar in early trade
thread.title_full: Rupee strengthens 8 paise against dollar in early trade

title: Rupee strengthens 8 paise against dollar in early trade
text: Rupee strengthens 8 paise against dollar in early trade Domestic equity markets opening with gains supported the rupee Press Trust of India | September 2, 2015 Last Updated at 09:32 IST email this article Type address separated by commas Your Email: Enter the characters shown in the image. Send me a copy: Image via Shutterstock ALSO READ Rupee weakens below 65.50/dollar to lowest since Sept 2013 Rupee trims gains on dollar demand by importers Rupee recoups losses, trades flat in morning trade Rupee weakens in early trade on capital outflows Rupee breaches 64 mark as importers buy dollars The rupee appreciated by 8 paise to 66.14 against the US dollar in early trade on increased selling of the American currency by exporters and banks. Forex dealers said domestic equity markets opening with gains supported the rupee, but dollar's strength against other currencies overseas capped the gains. The rupee had recovered by 26 paise to close at 66.22 against the US dollar yesterday on fresh selling of the greenback by banks and exporters. The benchmark BSE Sensex rose by 242.93 points, or 0.94%, to 25,939.37 in early trade.
